creator: hademenos@sbcglobal.net
text:
well somehow apache managed to install on my NT server. but
when i type http://www.poorfolks.org the default page does not
come up.. i think iexplore looks in a particular directory for the
default.htm page. i have disabled iis so there is no interference
but still the home address doesnt bring up a default page.
can you advise me how to correct this.

This hostname has no dns A record.
Please place such questions onto the user's mailinglist.
(http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users)

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
i do have an A record for www.poorfolks.org in my nameservers zone.
i am not sure what to say except that i would like to use apache but it
still needs a little work. it appears that iexplore 5 or so looks in a
particular directory for the default page. it should not be too much trouble to
recode apache to use the same directorys that iis is using. try to upload apache
again when you have a work=around for this problem. if i can't see the homepage
locally i doubt if anyone on the internet can see it either. also i did a find
file on the system and never found httpd.conf so it still is a little premature
but would like to see it aboard nt/2000/2003. it is still possible however
to leave it on linux and just interface a linux with a ms computer on the 
network.
creator: hademenos@sbcglobal.net

text:
one last bug...i need to stop the apache service for now so it doesn't interfere
with port 80 until we can get the default page working. i did a search on my
drive d and even on c although win95 is on c..i can't find apache to do a 
command line stop. i also cannot find httpd or any service name to stop the 
server...please advise.
creator: hademenos@sbcglobal.net

text:
i need to stop the apache service and it is not showing up in the services 
running or task manager. also the command line apache is missing so i can't stop
it that way either. please advise.
creator: hademenos@sbcglobal.net

text: Please move these questions to the users' mailing list as Andre pointed out... they can be handled much more effectively there.  This database is only for documenting bugs, not for handling user support.  Thanks, Cliff
creator: jwoolley@apache.org

is no info on the users mailing list.
